Row.Text: Order the unit to attack the selected tile.
When inside friendly territory, this unit may Paradrop to another tile. After doing so, it will still have movement to perform other actions.
When inside friendly territory, this unit may Paradrop up to {1_NumTiles} tiles away. After doing so, it will still have movement to perform other actions.
Order the unit to sweep an area for air and ground-based interceptors, clearing the way for future air strikes.
Order the unit to remotely attack the selected tile.
Paradrops to a specified location. The mission is subject to interception.
Upgrade the unit to {TXT_KEY_GRAMMAR_A_AN << {@1_UnitName}}. This requires {2_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Performing this action within your territory will provide {1_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Your unit must be in friendly territory in order to upgrade.
Your unit must be in a city in order to upgrade.
You lack the necessary funds to upgrade this Unit.
You need {1_ResourcesString} to upgrade this Unit.
You need to move this unit to an empty tile to upgrade this Unit.
The air patrol with your {@1_UnitName} encountered no resistance!
"You negotiated a trade embargo against us!"
"You brought in a war ally against us!"
All civilizations conduct their turns at the same time
Players can "hot-join" into an AI civilization's slot at any time
Turns are limited by a timer which scales based on the size of the largest civilization
An improvement or route in this tile may not be used until repaired. Pillaging an improvement will earn [ICON_GOLD] Gold and heal your unit by 25 points.
{1_PlyrName} has proven that the world is round!
Your maps have proven that the world is round! Your ships receive a {1_Change} Movement bonus.
All of the player's moves are accelerated
By completing your empire's Shrine, you may now adopt a State Religion!
Players are not allowed to go to war with one another.
Players start at war with one another and may not go to peace.
In order to be eliminated from the game, a player must have all of his Cities AND Units destroyed.
Prevents this game from being loaded while mods are active. Useful for competitive games.
Each time the game is loaded, the random number seed is regenerated. This means if you attack after loading, you might get a different result from the first time you played.
Barbarians and their Encampments do not appear on the map.
Whatever the state of war or peace the game begins with, the players may not change once the game is underway. Useful for mods, like World War II.
Players are not allowed to burn cities down after capturing them.
Ancient Ruins do not appear on the map.
HUMAN players are only ever allowed to build or own one city.
Players may make game-long permanent alliances with one another, allowing shared victory.
The rate at which Barbarians spawn is greatly increased.
Instead of acting as they normally do, a random personality will be picked for each AI leader, making the game more unpredictable.
Players may choose to defer selecting a Social Policy until later, instead of needing to pick immediately.
Players may choose to defer selecting a Unit Promotion until later, instead of needing to pick immediately.
Disables matching Civilizations to certain map conditions. Starts will be totally random.
Disables research system. Civilizations are locked at the starting technology level.
Disables policy system. No policies granted in the game.
No penalties or benefits from happiness.
Disables the tutorial popups for the duration of the game.
Lying in wait are treacherous Barbarians!
Exploring the ruins reveals ancient scriptures which provide your Unit new combat training!
In the ruins you find the treasures of an ancient empire! You have received {1_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gold!
Amongst the ruins you find ancient medicines which your Unit uses to heal its wounded.
You discover a crudely-drawn map which outlines the surrounding area!
You find survivors among the ruins, which agree to join your empire as Scouts!
You find survivors among the ruins, which agree to join your empire as Settlers!
Discovered in the ruins are the secrets of an advanced technology!
You find a group of Warriors willing to join your civilization!
You find survivors among the ruins, which agree to join your empire as Workers!
Can Spend Gold to Finish Production in a City
Can Sacrifice Population to Finish Production in a City
{@2_CivName} has set the city of {@1_CityName} ablaze!!!
"We Love the King Day" has ended in the City of {@1_CityName}. It now demands [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]{@2_ResourceName}[ENDCOLOR]!
"We Love the King Day" has ended in the City of {@1_CityName}. It now demands a new Resource you've not yet discovered!
You have completed {@1_BldgName}! Choose a free technology...
{3_player} has reduced your defenses in {@1_CityName} to {2_NewVal}%!
You have captured a Barbarian Encampment and recovered {1_Num} Gold!
You have set the city of {@1_CityName} ablaze!!!
You have discovered a source of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]{@1_ResourceName}[ENDCOLOR] near {@2_CityName}!
Your {1_UnitName} has reduced the defenses of {@2_CityName} to {3_Num}%!
The enemy has been spotted near {@1_CityName}!
An enemy {@1_EnUName} ({2_Num} damage) attacked your {@3_UnitName} ({4_Num} damage)!
An enemy {@1_EnUName} ({2_Num} damage) attacked your City of {@3_CityName} ({4_Num} damage)!
Your Civilization is the first to discover [COLOR_TECH_TEXT]{@1_TechName}[ENDCOLOR]! Choose a free technology...
{1_PlyrName} has gifted you a group of {2_UnitName}!
{1_GPName} has been born in a far away land!
{TXT_KEY_GRAMMAR_UPPER_A_AN << {@1_ImpName}} has been destroyed by a marauding {@3_civ_adjective} {@2_UnitName}!
{@1_CityName} can no longer work on {@2_BldgName}. The lost [ICON_PRODUCTION] is converted into {3_NumGold}[ICON_GOLD]!
A Nuclear Meltdown has occurred in {@1_CityName}!!!
{1_PlyrName} launches {TXT_KEY_GRAMMAR_A_AN << {2_UnitName}}, but it is shot down by {3_Plyr2Name}!!!
You have pillaged {1_Num} [ICON_GOLD] from the destruction of {@2_CityName}!!!
{1_PlyrName} has made a Permanent Alliance with {2_TeamName}!
{1_RelName} has been founded in a distant land!
An unmet Player has adopted a Religion!
You have completed a majestic Shrine in {@1_CityName} to honor {@2_ReligionName}! You may now train Missionaries there to spread the faith.
You have learned of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]{@1_ResourceName}[ENDCOLOR], which the City of {@2_CityName} demands!
{@1_PrjctName} has been completed in a far away land!
{@1_UnitName} was disbanded because of a lack of funds!
A distant Civilization has circumnavigated the Globe!
[COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]{1_UnitName}[ENDCOLOR] {1_UnitName: plural 1?has; other?have;} been created in a far away land!
A distant civilization is the first to discover {@1_TechName}!
What would you like to research next?
{@1_WndrName} {@1_WndrName: plural 1?has; other?have;} been built in a far away land!
Your {@1_UnitName} was intercepted by an enemy {@2_EnUName}! ({3}% Damage)
Your {@1_UnitName} ({3_Num} damage) was bombarded by an enemy {@2_EnUName}!
Your {@1_UnitName} was destroyed after being bombarded by an enemy {@2_EnUName}!
Your {@1_UnitName} ({3_Num} damage) was bombarded by the enemy City of {@2_CityName}!
Your {@1_UnitName} bombarded an enemy {@2_EnUName} and destroyed it!
Your City of {@1_CityName} was raided by Barbarians, and {2_Num} Gold was stolen from the national treasury!
While defending, your City of {@1_CityName} was captured by {TXT_KEY_GRAMMAR_A_AN << {@3_owner_adjective}} {@2_EnUName} ({4_Num} damage)!
Your defenses in {@1_CityName} have been reduced to {2_Num}% by {TXT_KEY_GRAMMAR_A_AN << {3_UnitName}}!
You have discovered a source of [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]{@1_ResourceName}[ENDCOLOR] near {@2_CityName}!
Thanks to your intercepting {@1_UnitName}, the {@2_owner_adjective} {@3_EnUName} attacking your {@4_DefUnitName} has been shot down!
Thanks to your intercepting {@1_UnitName}, we damaged the {@2_owner_adjective} {@3_EnUName} ({4_Num} damage) attacking your {@5_DefUnitName}.
While defending, your City of {@1_CityName} ({2_Num} damage) killed {TXT_KEY_GRAMMAR_A_AN << {@4_owner_adjective}} {3_EnUName}!
Your {@1_UnitName} has reduced the defenses of {@2_CityName} to {3_NewVal}%!
Your {@1_UnitName} ({2_Num} damage) captured the enemy City of {@3_CityName}!
Your {@1_UnitName} died attacking an enemy {@2_EnUName} ({3_Num} damage)!
Your {@1_UnitName} died attacking the enemy City of {@2_EnUName} ({3_Num} damage)!
The Barbarians have killed your {@1_UnitName} because you refused to pay their ransom!
Your {@1_UnitName} was shot down by an enemy {@2_EnUName}!
While defending, your {@1_UnitName} was destroyed by {TXT_KEY_GRAMMAR_A_AN << {@3_owner_adjective}} {@2_EnUName} ({4_Num} damage)!
While defending, your {@1_UnitName} was destroyed by a disguised {@2_EnUName} ({3_Num} damage)!
Your {@1_UnitName} ({2_Num} damage) attacked an enemy {@3_EnUName} ({4_Num} damage)!
Your {@1_UnitName} ({2_Num} damage) attacked the enemy City of {@3_CityName} ({4_Num} damage)!
Our {@1_Num} has withdrawn from enemy melee attack.
An enemy {@1_Num} has withdrawn from your melee attack.
Your City of {@1_CityName} ({3_Num} damage) was bombarded by an enemy {@2_EnUName}!
Do Not Automatically Select The Next Unit
Are you sure you want to {@1_ActionName}?
Are you sure you want to {@1_ActionName}?[NEWLINE]The current Tile Improvement will be replaced.
Are you sure you want to {@1_ActionName}?[NEWLINE]The current Tile Improvement will be replaced and a trade route may be disconnected.
Are you sure you want to raze this City? (This can be undone)
Does this mean WAR against {1_Team}?!? They are under the protection of:
Entering [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]{1_CivAdj}[ENDCOLOR] lands will trigger WAR! Are you sure?
Entering [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]{1_CivAdj}[ENDCOLOR] will trigger WAR! Are you sure?
Entering [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]{1_CivAdj}[ENDCOLOR] lands is an unfriendly act of bullying! Are you sure?
(You can peacefully enter if you sign an Open Borders Treaty.)
You have pillaged {1_Num} [ICON_GOLD] from the capture of {@2_CityName}!
What would you like to do with this City?
This City was formerly owned by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{@1_PlayerName}[ENDCOLOR]. You have the opportunity to return it to them, for which they would be grateful.
This City was formerly owned by [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{@1_PlayerName}[ENDCOLOR]. You have the opportunity to return it to them, for which they would be eternally grateful.

[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Annexing[ENDCOLOR] the City into your empire causes it to become a normal City that produces quite a bit of extra [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Annexing this City will increase [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness by {1_Num}.

By turning the City into a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Puppet[ENDCOLOR], it will generate Gold, Science, Culture, etc. for you, but you [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]may not choose what it produces[ENDCOLOR] or customize the City.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]It will contribute much less [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] than an Annexed City, and will not increase the cost of your Social Policies and Great People. If you choose this, you may later Annex the City at any point.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Puppeting this City will increase [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness by {1_Num}.

The City will burn [ICON_RAZING] down by 1 population each turn until it reaches 0, and is removed from the game. This produces quite a bit of extra [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness during the razing.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Razing[ENDCOLOR] this City will increase [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness by {1_Num}. This [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness will decrease by one each turn.
Go to the city screen. You may not change anything while inside.

Do you want to annex the puppet of {@1_CityName} into your empire? It will allow you to choose Production, but will increase your [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness and slow your acquisition of new Policies and Great People. You will not be able to reverse this.
What would you like to build in this city?
What would you like to purchase in this city?
It will restore functionality to the pillaged improvement on this tile.
If a Tile Improvement has been pillaged, a Worker may repair it.
It is not needed for connecting our cities together, and is costing us [ICON_GOLD] Maintenance.
You may remove a road or railroad that has been built in a tile.
To play internet games, the game needs to be launched with Steam active and with an active internet connection.

Online Interactions Not Rated by the ESRB
Uses Granny [RED]Animation[/RED]. Copyright (C) 1999-2010 by RAD Game Tools, Inc.
The Bering Strait and lands surrounding, including the Russian Far East, Kamchatka, and Alaska.
Great Britain, Ireland, and countless smaller islands.
Explore the Caribbean, in all its tropical splendor.
A map that spans the southern tip of Texas all the way up to the eastern tip of Nova Scotia.
This map focuses exclusively on Japan, with no surrounding countries in play.
Your turn has ended. Please email the save file to the next player in line. You can find the save file in your saves/pbem directory.
PINCH 2 fingers on the screen to Zoom OUT and STRETCH 2 fingers apart on the screen to Zoom IN.
DRAG 1 finger over buttons or terrain to see tool tips.[NEWLINE]DRAG a unit out of its hex to enter movement mode.
DRAG 2 fingers on the screen to pan the game camera and move scrollbar menus.
DOUBLE-TAP 1 finger on the screen to issue Move orders to the current unit.
To exit Move Mode without issuing an order, tap a second finger.
TAP 3 fingers to close screens or open the game menu.
Accelerates/Decelerates movement when dragging the map.
Accelerates/Decelerates movement when zooming the map.
